p: Seasonal influenza typically occurs every year in the late fall or winter in temperate regions [ 11] while the seasonality is less clearly defined in tropical and subtropical regions [ 12]. Seasonality patterns of influenza in eastern Africa including Ethiopia, have not been clearly established [ 13]. However, some evidences from different studies indicated that Influenza A (H1N1) pdm2009, Seasonal Influenza A (H3N2) and Influenza B are circulating in different countries of sub-Saharan Africa [ 14â€“ 16].
